text: Très impressionnante, fruite, gout de banane. Je ne m"y attendais pas a une telle qualité.

Keg at Brasseur du Temps, Gatineau.  Cloudy reddish copper colour, small head. Tart raspberry aroma. Mid dry with medium-full body and dense, rounded mouthfeel. Caramel and tart raspberry juice. Mild peppery warming finish. More tartness than phenols.

Une bière dun beau brun ambré, une une belle carbonatation et peu deffervescence. Au nez, cest très sucré avec des odeurs de bananes bien présentés et également de cannes de bonbon. En bouche, on retrouve également beaucoup ces saveurs ultra sucrées de bananes et de cannes de noel qui sont ultra présentes en bouche. Lalcool, à 8% de pourcentage, se cache fort bien derrière le sucre. Au finale cest une bière agréable, quon souhaiterait peut-être un peu plus complexe pour devenir une incontournable.
Pours hazy and red in colour. Big malty and huge banana bread aroma with wheat or barley, esters and pepper. Medium to fuller body with a sweet profile and a sweet wheat/barley taste. Decent.

Apparence : Cuivrée, semi-limpide, léger col brun sans rétention, carbonatation moyenne à élevée et moyennement rapide. 

Nez : Caramel sucré, légère touche dalcool, pain grillé, banane. 

Goût : Caramel sucré, raisins secs, touche dalcool.

Sensation : Effervescence moyenne, corps moyen, longue finale sucrée et légèrement amère, picotement dans les joues.

Bref : Bière décevante : trop sucrée, peu complexe, on ne retrouve pas en bouche lintensité de la banane que lon percevait au nez. Corps tout de même léger pour 8%. Ce nest pas mauvais, mais ce nest pas balancé non plus.

Orangée version caramel peu de carbo pas de collet. 
Aromes surtout caramel, pain, sucre roux. 
Effervescente, légèrement liquoreuse caramel mais un peu courte.

En bouteille, bière brune orangée très peu de mousse. Arômes de malt, fruits mûres, bananes, pêches. Similaire en bouche avec un peu de noix et finale sucrée avec des notes de sirop d'érable. Palais onctueux, chaleur de l'alcool bien enrobante. Une des meilleures bières québécoise.
Bottle.Rreddish amber colot, but weak foam. Aroma: liqueur, malt, dried fruit, raisins, white sweet porto, almost jam. Taste: sweet, rich malt, wheat, raisins and dried fruit.

Couleur rouge vin, un peu rosé, une bouteille qui date davril 2015. Odeur malté caramel, le sucre. En bouche, on y ressent le caramel, le sucre, un mince arrière goût de banane, aucune séduction de lalcool mise-à-part totalement en fin de bouche qui vient réchauffé un peu ce liquide!

341 ml bottle @ Timo A.
Pours clear amber color with a small head. Quite a lot of berries on the nose, caramel malts, faint honey and toffee too. Caramel malty flavor, some berry notes present here too, strawberries, faint wheat, yeast and wood. Not quite as good as I expected, different if anything. Decent.
4324
(TAp) clear, bright reddish Amber colour with a small beige head; aroma of lilies, honey; balanced, rich flavour with a long, light bitter sweet finish; oily palate; excellent

Not readily does such a style find its way into my gullet as often as I would choose. Like a heavenly liquid banana streusel, this satiating sense-pleaser doesnt miss any notes. Not too simple yet not overly complex, 8%abv feels remarkably drinkable in this clean package of nutty, toffee, brown bread and nanner goodness, piqued by the slightest leathery lovin. While not for everyone, I thoroughly enjoyed this velvety light brown homage to German zymurgy.

Cloudy dark reddish brown with a one finger khaki head that fades quickly to a sheet. Nose is dark fruit with yeast, brown sugar, and banana supporting. Faint floral hop notes. Light+ sweet caramel with a medium fruity tartness and light spice. Medium creamy mouth with soft carbonation.

750ml bottle from La Trappe au Fromage in Gatineau, Quebec. Ruby brown in colour with a thin but very long lasting tan head, excellent lacing. The aroma is of caramel, bananas, brown sugar and dark fruits. The flavour is of light alcohol, some caramel, dark fruits, sugary, malty, lightly sweet. Sweet mouthfeel, medium body, moderate carbonation. Finishes long, creamy, warming. I like this one quite a bit. Nice richness to this.

Draught @ the brewpub (8 oclock). Pours nearly clear copper brown with airy off-white head. Clear aroma of malt and fruit, with notes of yeast and hoppy touches. Sweet flavour of caramel and fruit, with notes of malt and some hoppy touches. Sweetish aftertaste with sporadic bitter notes. Warming alcohol presence. Well, quite sweet for the style but definitely drinkable and not that bad.

Robe brune ambré, léger col de mousse, dentelle épaise et moyennent collante. Arômes de malt caramélisé, dattes, cassonade, sirop de bananes et tarte aux bleuets. Le tout accompagné dun petit côté épicé. En bouche, saveurs de malt, sucre candi, dattes. Une légère transition laisse ressortir un goût de pain dépices et de houblons. Finale brève et légèrement sucré, rappellant les bananes. Texture soyeuse et enveloppante, effervescence à point.

Rousse tirant sur le brun, voilée, avec un très mince col de mousse beige. Nez fruité (petits fruits rouges), de banane, de levure, sucré et légèrement dalcool. Goût caramelisé, de petits fruits rouges, de banane, de levure et un peu épicé.
Overall: Fruit soup, sour citric peel.Note: On-tap at Les Brasseurs Du Temps. Reviewed 2015-04-29.

UPDATED: JUN 28, 2015 Bouteille de 341ml au Marché des Brasseurs. Rousse trouble avec une mince et fugace mousse blanchâtre. Arôme de bananes, caramel, levure et alcool. Au goût cest semblable sauf que la puissance de lalcool est agressante... cest comme si on avait versé 1 once de Jack dans ma bière. Si javais voulu anesthésier mes amygdales, jaurais pris un Jack sur glace, et bye la visite ... ce nest pas le feel que jattends dune bière. Courte en bouche sur une finale sucrée et alcoolique, on me lavait tant vantée que jai été fort déçu. 

EDIT; retour sur cette bière - ma première bouteille devait être malade... je lai trouvée moins agressante cette fois ci, je remonte donc mon pointage de quelques crans
Super bière bien caramélisée avec arôme de fruits. Couleur tire ste-Catherine... un vrai délice en bouche

Bottle from mix pack bought at Halles St-Jean. Aroma: bananas, lots of it, caramel, spices, cereals. App: hazy amber red with small beige head..Taste and palate: creamy medium body than oily mouthful, a tad watery, light-medium sweetness, average carbonation. Finish is sweet. A bit sticky too. Overall: right on the style with the strong banana aroma, appearance and taste.

Bottle 341ml.
Pours hazy dark amber with low beige head. Good lacing. Aroma is of bananas, spices, caramel, sugar, yeast. Taste is of bananas, spices, sugar, caramel, bitterness, roasted malt, yeast, alcohol. Palate: Full bodied. Medium carbonation. Sticky on the lips. Overall: Alcohol and yeast yields appreciable sensations. Just slightly too sweet to be drinkable? Complex.

Served in a Duvel Glass around 10 degrees:

This is a doppelweizenbock that a good friend of mine bought me and the first of the style I try.
It pours a clouded amber letting loose some cherry wood highlights with about a finger of lightly tanned head. This head is finely structured and seems semi-unctuous, showing medium lacing and retention.

You get on the nose tons of fruit with a dominant aroma of candied banana, apricot and caramel or milk chocolate. The alcohol is noticeable behind all these appealing scents but not in a bothering way.

On the tongue, this brew offers a semi-sharp bittersweet attack from good roasted malts paired with a candied banana / milk chocolate backbone. The hops also contribute to the bitterness since they come through nicely the nutty aspect of the yeasts. The harmony between the malts and the sweet fruit is pretty good and leads the way to a mouthfeel best described as slightly oily and creamy. Finishes hoppy with strong vapours of alcohol I found enjoyable but perhaps throwing it a bit off balance. Just a bit really since it just delivers more corpus. This a generous brew I would recommend with semi-strong or strong cheeses like Saint-Damasse, Rouy, Oka, Champfleury and would pair it with grilled beef or chorizo.

Overall, this doppelweizenbock is a complex brew and I enjoyed it very much.

Dark copper with a nice light brown head. Banana bread, literally, with light spice and light caramel. Mainly sweet, no sign of bitterness. Medium body,a little creamy with an average carbonation. Aftertaste is caramel/banana bread.

Bière brune de 8 % dalcool. Elle possède un beau col au versement. Elle possède un odorat sucré et céréalier. Elle possède un bon goût de banane en bouche, avec une amertume de petits fruits. Il y a aussi une petite touche poivrée, et une finale métallique. Il y a un bon goût crémeux style caramel. Très bonne !

Pours a clear dark copper with a really thin white head that fades into a small rim that doesnt leave much lacing. Nose is of banana bread and really light spices, nice. Taste is of same banana bread and light toffee, not too sweet but still really malty. Some cloves. Body is medium-full and mouthfeel slightly syrupy. Carbonation is moderate and alcohol pretty well hidden. Overall a fine weizendoppelbock or whatever that is and most certainly the most interesting BdT Ive had yet. Id drink that again.

Par chance, je navais pas lu létiquette avant de déguster!! Je naurais donc pas pu découvrir par moi-même ce parfum de banane, caramel, alcool et levure si agréable. Au goût, cest très mordant et épicé et la finale sadoucit en devenant plus sucrée. Me rappelle un peu (pour certains aspects) la 17 dUnibroue...

These guys are now 3/4 in their sampler back, for my money. Ironically the one beer I thought Id enjoy most (Diable au Corps) was the one I enjoyed least (its still aight, though. 
This pours a dark, reddish amber with a bit of off-white head. Nose is busy, but complementary. Ripe bananas, caramelized sugar, raisins/dates, dough and spices and a bit of alcohol. Taste is sweet, fruity malt, lots of banana, caramel, roasted nuts, spiced raisins - the effect is almost like Branston Pickle without the vinegar element. Alcohol is barely noticeable but well-concealed, and the finish has a bit of dryness that wraps everything up nicely. Really enjoyable.

Dumduminator is an 8% doppelweizenbock which poured a clear amber brown with a filmy beige head. The aroma was of a caramel coated banana bread while the taste was the same with added nuts & spices. Solid.

On tap at the brewpub. Cloudy mahogany with a foamy beige head. Flavors are wheat, toasted malts, ripe bananas, berries, raisins, spices, caramel, brown sugar with floral notes. Medium to full body, moderate carbonation, oily texture.

Apparence: D?une couleur brun caramel opaque, elle est coiffée d?une mousse moyenne d?une durée moyenne. Effervescence difficile à évaluer, mais semble quasi inexistante. 

Arômes: Au nez, ce sont des arômes de malt caramélisé et légèrement épicé. 

Saveurs: En bouche, cest un corps moyen. Au goût, cest des saveurs de malt légèrement caramélisé avec des notes de réglisse. De durée moyenne, il y a quasiment aucune effervescence, idem pour lamertume. 

Fiche technique 
Style: Doppelweizenbock
Format: 750 ml
Taux d?alcool : 8%
Température: 10°C

Appearance: Pours a thick hazy brown colour with no head.
Aroma: Molasses and malt.
Flavour: Banana, molasses, gum, caramel, toffee, coriander, bread, malt. 
Overall: Wow, there is a lot going on here! There is a ton of sweetness and fruit right up front but then there are some more subtle nuances of bread and grains that start to come through. This is definitely not a session beer but is something well worth trying and something I wouldnt mind having periodically.

Bouteille de 750 ml achetée chez Bière, Etc. à Montréal au coût de $11.49. Dégustée le 7 janvier 2013. Bière rouge brique voilée. Mousse peu, col mince et éphémère, beige foncé. Très peu effervescente. Odeur de cognac, de fruits secs (figues, dattes, raisins), dalcool. Un peu forte, très sucrée, peu amère. Saveur de noix, de toffee marquée, dalcool en finale. Céréales ne ressortent pas beaucoup. Très bonne mais aurait pu avoir un peu plus deffervescence, quasi flatte. Peut-être un peu trop sucrée, presque sirupeuse.

750 ml bottle. Neat little beer here. very hazy amber-brown color, low carbonation and small head but that is acceptable for this style , very good belgian yeast. not too hoppy. just a little spicy and sweetness. the only down I can think of is that its a bit too tasty for a Bock. Would definitely buy again!! Isnt that label awesome??

Very well done weizen bock - one of the better products Ive had from BDT. A great take on the style with some light cidery notes, some lemon, coriander and even a little florals. Great to taste the style done well. Pours orange with pretty good lacing and well balanced. Tap at brewpub.

"At BDT brewpub. About an inch of foamy head, but didnt stay long. Deep amber colour. Aromas of banana and some fruits (grapes), with just a tad of the alcohol smell coming through. Nice fruity flavours as well. Bananas for sure as well as berries. Some spices. Sweet and tangy. At 8%, goes down pretty easy. Very good patio brew!

Pours a cloudy reddish deep copper with a medium sized tan head. Aroma is banana, cloves, sweet bready wheat, caramel and moderate fruity esters. Flavour is fruity esters, banana, caramel, spicy phenols, cloves, and honey.

Thanks to cfrancis for this. Pours a clear dark brown with a nice frothy light brown head that leaves some lace. Aroma of caramel, dark dried fruits, honey, banana and cloves. Taste is caramel, dark dried fruits, banana, alcohol, honey and a nice bit of spicy clove on the finish. Very well balanced beer and the best weizenbock that Ive had to date.
Évaluation no. 73 Mars 2011. Couleur brune. Mousse peu persistante. Nez de caramel léger avec houblon. Attaque de caramel, de bananes, de malt brulé. Bien balancée au niveau des saveurs. Complexe.

UPDATED: NOV 27, 2015 Bière brune pâle tirant vers lorangée, parfaitement voilée, effervescence moyenne, et surmontée dun col brunâtre plutôt étroit mais tout de même assez dense, mousseux et persistant. Arômes de pain grillé et pâtisserie, avec dabondants sucres foncés (caramel et cassonade, avec un peu mélasse et tire dérable). Effluves également de petits fruits foncés confits (raisin, cerise, datte, figue, pruneau) avec une levure à Weizen bien mise en évidence, banane bien mûre et épices (clou de girofle, poivre, piment de la Jamaïque, muscade), notes de malt fumé (charcuterie), touche herbacé (houblon?), et petite pointe alcoolisée. Nez très agréable, très intense, complexité très élevée. En bouche, pétillement élevé sur la langue avec une onctuosité tout de même intéressante au palais, on note un certain moelleux, un certain velouté, et cest légèrement liquoreux. Au goût, saveurs bien maltés, caramel, cassonade, léger érable, avec pain grillé et pâtisserie, mais cest tout de même loin dêtre trop sucré. Abondant fruité en bouche également, petits fruits foncés confits avec évidents esters de fermentation (surtout banane, mais aussi mangue, poire). On retrouve également les épices et le malt fumé en bouche, alors que la finale apporte dagréables et chaleureuses notes alcoolisées. Lamertume est minimale, et le houblon est subtil (floral avec notes herbacées?). Peut-être un peu moins intense en bouche quau nez, cette bière est très complexe et rudement bonne! Excellente!

Bière de couleur brune foncé avec un col mousseux moyen teinté. Nez de banane dépices et de caramel. En bouche cest très aromatique et complexes. Bananes épices caramel et autres fruits. Cest bizarre a dire mais je la trouve très savoureuse mais un peu trop on dirait. Jaime mieux une weizen bock plus sèche et moins savoureuse mais très bonne bière tout de meme!

Cette bière est bien brune, bien trouble et bien odorante (pommes, bananes, muscade et autres épices). En bouche, mêmes notes doucement épicées, avec une levure évoquant les bananes mûres et la muscade. Style trop ignoré ou mal connu au Québec, cette "doppelweizenbock" est tout de même réussie, dans un domaine où ce brasseur a déjà quelques longueurs davance sur la concurrence.

Super super! Une bière de ma région et tout simplement EXCELLENTE!! À reboire et reboire! Bravo Brasseur du temps!

Ketail

Bière brune trouble, bien mousseuse, aux reflets rougeâtres. Nez de prunes, de caramel et de sucre dorge. En bouche, une base bien maltée et sucrée est inondée de fruits rouges (raisins). Un délice pour les papilles les plus fines.
Odeur résineuse, note de vin, belle robe brun rouge, goût un peu sucré, légèrement fruité mais beaucoup moins que dautre weizenbock.  Arrière goût chaleureux plaisant.
Bottle from ????, purple brown pour. Aromas of caramel toffee, dried dark fruits, maInly figs & raisins. Red wine notes. Sweet. Banana notes lingering. A bit all over the place. Decent

Le Brasseur du Temps est maintenant dans mon top 5 des microbrasseries québécoises. Malgré le prix un peu plus élevé que la moyenne, cette microbrasserie me surprend toujours avec ses bières qui sortent des sentiers battus. Cette Doppelweizenbock ma dabord surpris par son bouquet mystérieux : après quelques tentatives olfactives, jai fini par discerner de la banane bien mûre ainsi que de la mélasse. Dune couleur brun brique et voilée, voire opaque, cette bière amène par son goût quelque chose dassez fidèle au bouquet ; sy ajoute un goût de levure puissant, astringeant même. Versée dans un verre tulipe un 23 décembre, avec des terrines et un fromage à pâte molle. Ce nest sans doute pas le genre de bière que je rachèterais à chaque semaine, mais elle ma quand même surpris et satisfait par son goût original et hors du commun - du moins pour mes habitudes.

Pours a dark brown-red with no head. Smell is sweet with banana and cloves. Palate is medium-thick with strong and good mouth filling carbonation. Taste is sweet malt and a whole lot of banana, has a slightly spicy aftertaste. VERY good.

750ml bottle, slight hazy ruby-mahogany hue, with a bubbly tan-beige head, nice yeasty light banana fruity, spicy nose, with some dried sultana raisin, plum, fid esters, and some nutmeg, cloves, toasted, caramelized, wheat, bready malt accents, with some brown sugar, cookie dough, toffee, brown chocolate notes in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a yeasty, fruity, plum juice, dried raisin, fig, date, ripe apple, slight clove, nutmeg spicy character, with some toffee, caramelized, wheat, toasted, biscuity malty, faint brown chocolate flavors, with a big residual sugar, brown sugar backbone, leading towards a yeasty, juicy dried fig, plump, raisin, spicy, toasted maltiness, subtle hop bitterness finish.

Bottle 750ml. @ The Danish Summer Gathering, TFODRBSG12, Ulfborg.Clear medium red brown colour with a small to average, fizzy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, caramel, wheat, moderate yeasty, yeast. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and light moderate bitter with a average to long duration, banana notes. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20120818]

On tap at Bières et saveurs (Chambly). Pours cloudy brown. No head nor lacing. Aroma: malt, caramel, banana. Taste: something like fruits cake, malt, yeast. Pleasant sweetness. Full bodied. Seems on style.
Bottle @ Danish Summer Gathering Ulfborg, 2012. Pours unclear amber with a small head and lacings. Sweet caramel, bread, yeast and wheat. Full bodied. Fine.
Bottle @ TFODRBSG, Ulfborg. Hazy dark amber with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, wheaty, caramel and dried fruit. Flavor is quite sweet and light bitter. Sweet finish. 180812

Bottle, at TFODRBSG 2012. An unclear, brown beer with a small, dense, light beige head. The aroma is sweetish, lightly roasted and with some caramel. Hints of banana too. A bit weak on the palate, medium bodied and pleasantly carbonated. Caramel, some roasted notes, some banana and a light coffee touch. A quite tasteful one, but to be frank, and a little bit rude, the best part of the beer is the label. 120818

Bottle 750ml @ TFODRBSG12
Pours clear brown with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, wheat and hint of banana. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with a caramel and yeast finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Bottle @ FOneFan, Danish Ratebeer Summer Gathering 2012. Hazy dark brown/amber with small beige head. Aroma is malt, wheat, yeast and caramel. Flavour is malt, caramel, toffee, medium sweet, yeast, dark fruits, hop and a little rip fruit
Bottle @ Summer Gathering, Ulfborg. Nice head with good duration. Color is brown. Aroma and taste are rich fruits, caramel, malt, nuts and hops. Dry finish.

Bottle. Thanks TheJester! Pours bit hazy amber with a medium off white head. The aroma is loads of malt, toasted caramel and ripe fruit. The flavour is loaded with sweet wheat, banana, toasted malt, ripe fruit and some hops.

750 ml bottle. Pours a very foggy, reddish brown with a short-lasting white head. Smells like bananas. Tastes like caramel, milk chocolate, ripe pears and dried bananas. Very smooth finish, somewhat spicy. Body is average and velvety. Good doppelbock.

750ml bottle.  Slightly hazy ruby-copper pour with a large and lasting thick fizzy-foamy tan head.  Lush ripe, slightly acidic grain and herbal aroma, a hint of cocoa, and just a bit of alcohol presence.  Taste follows, but its quite "sweaty" - thick and chewy, modestly carbonated, quick-finishing - very nice drinker.

750ml bottle. A very cloudy brownish orange body with a small creme brûlée head. Aroma is sweet and yeasty most of all, grassy hops, orange peel, cinnamon.
Taste is yeasty, yeasty and again yeasty, very spicy and light at the same time, surprising considering its 8% ABV, a sweet aftertaste, some grassy nuances.
Solid brew.

355ml bottle - shared by Les Quebequois in Lithuania - thanks!
Blackcurrant and blackberry aroma. Bucketloads of esters in the retronasals. Heavier and denser in the mouth - sticky and heavy, almost stodgy, and with quite a caramelly roast. Not getting the usual wheat notes, but getting of bocky ones instead. Doesnt exactly hide the alcohol, but that simply means this is a sipper rather than a glugger.

Verse une bière couleur caramel ornée dun col crème café. Au nez, un bouquet floral de caramel et fruits mûrs. En bouche, elle se veut légèrement sucrée avec des notes grillées. On perçoit également la banane et lalcool. Délicieuse bière, bien assemblée.
750 ml bottle.  Pours deep reddish brown in colour, with of white head.  Nice big sweet, raisiny sweet caramel arm a and taste.  Alcohol well hidden.  Really good.

Bottle 750 ml [2011] Thanks to Franky Boy for sharing. Appearance: Pours hazy red-brown with a medium beige head, quickly diminishing. Aroma: Banana is predominant. Sweet with notes of caramel, raisin, spices and alcohol. Taste: Banana, alcohol and notes of caramel. A bit watery and a dry finish. Overall: Good beer but lack of complexity.

Une mousse dense flotte sur un liquide ambré et voilé. Des arômes fruités, caramélisés, avec des notes épicées, suivis de pointes alcoolisées, forment la palette des odeurs. Goût semblable aux senteurs, avec une précision quand à la présence de la banane, ayant une pointe acidulée et une finale alcoolisée. Pour y avoir déjà goûté en fût, jétais resté sur limpression que cétait plus grandiose. Peut-être quen bouteille, son prix élevé, joue en sa défaveur ? Embouteillée le 11-04-11 Lot #40 (171-220212)
Bottle  cool label. Good foam on dark amber-copper. Sour raw yeasty scent. Airy light dry dark dry malt body. Dry booze with only hints of banana and chocolate.

Bouteille de 750ml reçue en cadeau! Bière trouble à la robe brune et aux reflets orangés surmontée dune épaisse mousse beige affichant une tenue de durée moyenne. Au nez, elle dévoile des arômes sucrés, une bonne dose de blé, du caramel, des épices et une légère touche florale. En bouche, la bière est sucrée, mais moins quanticipée, le malt, le caramel et le blé sont bien équilibrés par les houblons et une touche de malt torréfié. Les épices et les notes de pain grillé viennent complémenter cette Weizen bock. Le corps est riche et la gazéification est prononcée.

Pours a hazy reddish-brown, topped with a thin ring of off-white head; minimal lacing.  Inviting aroma of caramel, candied fruits (plums, raisins), and a boozy and bready undertone.  Prominent caramel and banana flavors come through in the taste, gradually tapering off to make way for a crisp wheat character through into the finish.  Boozy and candy-like aromatics linger after each sip, with a touch of bitter ashiness.  The first BDT beer Ive sampled, and I am impressed; very nice representation of the style.

Bouteille 750ml. De couleur brune-ambrée et voilée. Nez de levures fruitées (bananes, traces dagrumes et de mangues), de caramel sucré, moyen de blé et dépices (cannelle), léger de rôti et de pain avec des traces de sucre brun. Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen ainsi quune texture léger-moyen crémeuse et aux faibles notes sirupeuses. Goût de levures fruitées (léger de bananes, notes dananas et de raisins, traces dagrumes et de mangues) et légèrement épicées (cannelle, faibles traces de pain dépices) lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un goût de caramel, un moyen goût de blé légèrement rôti ainsi quun léger goût de pain puis en finale lon retrouve des notes dalcool. Post-goût moyen, légèrement amer dalcool très doux avec un goût de levures fruitées (pelures de bananes) ainsi que des notes de blé et des traces de rôti.

Cloudy pressed rasberry redish brown with a lasting yellowish head. Rasberry, banana and malt. Soft carbonation with a slightly sticky and thin texture and a medium body. Banana, alcohol, wheat, orange peel with a citrus aftertaste. Not really liking the sour aftertaste.

Bottle...
Aroma:caramel,banana,toffee...
Appeara redish-brown,light white head...
Flavor:vegetable,caramel,alcohol....

[4005-20110930] 750mL bottle. Sweet mango pear aroma. Murky, dark brown red body with a medium-lasting creamy foamy mocha head. Bitter sweet bread malt flavour with hops-infused orange peelings. Medium body. Good. (7/3/7/3/14) 3.4
Overheard: "Its naked poker midget pool." "Thats an Olympic event."
(c/o blackboy, w/ him, garthicus, GregClow, HogTownHarry, jerc)
Cloudy dark brown, mocha head. Whoa, loads of caramel in this one! Light banana, good amounts of roasted wheat. Huge caramel flavors, brown sugar and a light toastiness throughout! Nice stuff!

Thanks to Blankboy. Appearance: Rusty red, tiny white head. Aroma: Slightly Christmas-y, cinnamon, spices, yeasty with rum. Flavour: Spicy again with yeast, malt and a good toastiness to it and a long bitter finish. Lovely.

Bottle 750ml. Reddish brown pour, whitish head. Aroma of pineapple, quite fruity, brown sugar, interesting. Taste is quite sweet and fruity, brown sugar, fruity finish, lots of tropical fruits (sweet, not hoppy). Palate is a bit syrupy, full bodied. Better than I thought.

Amber colour, lacey. A little astringent in the finish and above average carbonation, which it doesnt need. Some chocolate malts,caramel, touch of bannana, some boozyness. Good example of a style I tend not to care for.

Bouteille de 750ml. (Merci Patrick). Bière brune trouble avec une couche de mousse beige durable. Le nez est très fruité et caramélisé. La bouche est fruité, lalcool est épicé. Une touche de blé caramélisé est perceptible. La finale est sucrée et amère. Drôle de bière, pas sur par contre.

750ml bottle shared by Goldorak.
Appearance : Hazy amber with a small head.

Aroma : Great wheat and nice big caramel notes. Bready and a bit mineral.

Taste : Big caramel with light mineral notes, soft carbonation. Finish lots of caramel with bready malt and yeast. Nice overcooked caramel but not too sweet.

Overall : Really nice surprise here. I really liked the strong caramel notes without it being too sweet. Nice bready malt presence with notes of wheat. Nice one !

Bouteille de 750 ml obtenue via Lubière. Arôme: Odeur de caramel fruité avec une pointe dagrumes. Apparence: La couleur est ambrée foncée avec une faible densité de bulle. Présence dun mince col beige mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de caramel fruité avec une pointe dépices. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement vineuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Légère présence de céréales en arrière goût. (Rating #3812)
Pours dark copper/orange with an off-white head.  Malt bomb! Aroma is huge sweet malt, lots of caramel, dark fruit, figs, raisins, bread. Flavor is malty sweet, sticky mouthfeel.

On tap at brewpub
Aroma: thick malty sticky aroma with light alcoholic hints, softer edges. 6+.
Appearance: hazed ruby amber with lighter fine top. 3-.
Body/Flavour/Palate: Full bodied. Tart, fruity, malty in character. Quiet dry top end with fruity sides. Refreshing crispness. Felt lighter than numbers suggested.

750 ml shared with Alex thx mate. App: copper with minimal white head. A: fruity, caramel, with a fair bit of citrus. F: body is full finish is bitter and medium long. O: pretty good suprisingly bitter. I was expecting more maltiness.

750ml bottle shared by jsprime. deep maroon with a tan head. dark fruit and winey aroma. full thick malty weizen bock flavour. a touch to roasty. almost at aventinus level but not quite there. thx jeff.

(75 cl)  Le liquide a une robe brune opaque.  La tête mousseuse est solide et laisse quelques traces sur le verre.  Le nez est caramélisé, touché par des effluves de gâteau aux dattes, frôlé par des raisins mûrs, entouré par des parfums de purée de bananes et doucement imprégné par le souffle court des clous de girofle.  Le goût est bien malté, très doux : le caramel se transforme en toffee et les épices chatouillent les papilles tandis que le pain aux bananes baigne dans un alcool goûteux.  En bouche, le liquide a une rondeur étonnante avec son effervescence modérée et sa texture soyeuse.  La finale présente une amertume dalcool épicé et passablement riche.

On tap at Brasseurs duTemps.The color is a hazy copper with a thin beige head. The aroma is of sweet fruits and malt. The taste is of spicies,malt, yeast and sweet fruits.It has a dry taste in the mouth very pleasing.

750ml bottle. Very dark blood orange colour, slight bit of puffy off-white head. Smells like dried dark fruits. Tastes like it smells but with a satisfying bitterness and a slightly burnt taste to the fruits. Finishes fruity but dry and satisfying. Very clean tasting, better than when I had it on tap.

Draught at the brewpub. Pours a cloudy copper-brown with a small beige head. Aroma of caramel, banana, vanilla, a hint of smoke, some toastiness and grain. Nice flavour of toasted malt, bananas, dark fruit, yeast and some light spices. Medium bodied. Very good stuff, I bought a bottle of it on the way out.

Appearance: Pours an opaque, thick-looking, brown-amber body with a thin, off-white head.

Smell: Rather sweet-scented with upfront scents of brown sugar and caramel given a light dusting of nutmeg, also notes of varied, various fruits giving off a tiny hint of tartness.

Taste: Toasty, bready maltiness with a large layering of heavily sweet caramel sauce. Underneath the chewy malts and sweetness is some fruity accents ranging from bananas to figs to even some stray raisins. Light earthy bitterness. A little vanilla crumb cake. Some spice peeking through the sweetness. Sweet, warming finish.

Mouthfeel: Near full body. Lightly carbonated.

Overall: DumDuminator is a weizenbock on the fuller side of the spectrum and definitely for those with a sweet tooth as its dense with residual sugars.

sample at Ale Atlanta on 6/2/11 thanks to Ale Sharpton who brought the bottle back from Quebec!  deep hazy orange pour with a 1/4" off white head.  spice, dark fruits (raisin / dates), and sugar on the nose.  sweet medium body with more dark fruits, caramel malt notes and a sweet, lighter finish with notes of wheat.  starts out thick and sweet and finishes smooth and crisp.

Was quite surprised to find this one in a 750ml brown bottle at my local Métro store. There was a few cases of these, with 12 bottles in each one of them. Must be the first bottling for BDT. Bottling date on back label is 1/04/11 #1458. Pours a cloudy mohagany-caramel colour with creamy beige head, good retention and nice lace. Active tiny-bubble carbonation. Aromas of sugars, caramel, toffee, alcohol, bread, fruits (raisins, dates) and hints of bananas. Creamy, silky smooth and a bit oily mouthfeel. The alcohol is definitely not felt in the taste though. The hop is present instead. Grassy, lightly sweet with some tarty banana finish. Pretty good overall for the style. Just not my style (and I am surprise they chose this style as one of there first brew in a bottle). They have balls, I guess.

On tap at Le Bateau de nuit, May 25th 2011.

REd amber color with no head, banana  aroma, caramel and malty alcoholic taste with grassy malt finish.

Rating # 19

750 ml bottle from the brewery, served at cellar temperature in a tulip glass. 06MA11.
App.:  Clear mahogany with a so-so light tan froth.
  
Aroma:  Sweet caramel, toffee, brown sugar, hints of molasses, a bit woodsy and grassy, a light tart fruit note, a touch of alcohol, some yeast, bread crust, light berries and esters, some wheat and cooked/boiled cereals.
  
Palate:  Medium+ body, full, velvety effervescence.
  
Flav.:  Deeper malts, sweet treacle, toffee, brown sugar, dark dried fruits, touches of brighter fruitiness, a little woodsy/grassy character, restrained esters, tasty overall; lightly sweet with black tea, brown sugar, sweet cake-like finish, vanilla, good.

Glad to have some take-home product.  Mainly because running a tap line from the brewery to my house would be cost-prohibitive.

750ml bottle. Dark amber with decent head - fades to a light lacing. Bread, plum, banana, malts but too sweet for my liking. Medium body, good carbonation, and decent mouthfeel but just doesnt sit very well, too sweet for my liking. From what I remember on tap I like this much better so will have to compare and possibly re-rate.

Bottle, thank you Colin and Kendra!  Well, I did an amazing sampler tray with Colin many moons ago here but never rated it, so this is my first rating for this fantastic brewpub.  Dark ruby brown, good sized tan foamy head.  Lots of dry yeast, bread, some fruit (raisins?) in aroma.  Taste:  great foamy mouthfeel, quite muted up front with just a hint of alcohol giving way to full profile of dark fruit, alcohol, warming bitterness.   Really nice actually, approachable, where most in this style can be overwhelming.  A simple approach and a success.

750 mL bottle.  (Thanks, Krista!)  Bottled 11/02.  Dont know if thats month/day or year/month.  Thick rusty orange in colour, and a vigorous pour resulted in a substantial orange-brown head that never completely disappeared.  Yeasty-fruity aroma is not far off of Aventinus.  Milder, perhaps.  The flavour is promising, momentarily, until you realize that its impossible to distinguish any individual flavours.  To use Aventinus as a comparison again, its like a poor photocopy, in which subtlety is lost.  Booze is well hidden.  Medium-full, creamy body.  Not bad by any means, but lacking in any distinctly appealing characteristics.

My Bottom Line:
Fieldberry jam and caramel coalesce over wooden and earthy wheat tones in this hefty, sweet sipper of a Weizenbock. 

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A veil of foam protects the cloudy mahogany.
-The commercial description on the back label is a tad misleading... The yeast does not offer loads of banana esters; in fact, it remains rather delicate in its contribution; some fruit here, some clove-y phenols, all enveloped in residual sugars and plump wheat.
-The aroma is softspoken for the style. Not that thats a problem, mind you.
-The wheat and yeast seem to merge in the flavor profile to make up those earthy angles.
-The residual sugars tend to overtake the carbonation, creating a heavy mouthfeel. It pretty much feels like you are drinking a Barley Wine (with a different flavor profile, of course).
-The finish, a continuation of the flavor profile, is rather short. 
-Alcohol is very well hidden; just a warming breeze on the back of the palate. Spicy hops choose to appear here, and only here.
-All flavors are harmonious and cohesive within the heavy body.
-Strangely enough, the English commercial description is better worded than the French. "La levure énergique laisse des traces de caramel..."?!? Ouch.
-All in all, this is a deliciously different strong brew for sweet teeth. Not super complex, but it does make for a scrumptious dessert libation.

Bottle.

Bottle: Poured a cloudy deep amber color ale with a nice foamy head with OK retention and some light lacing. Aroma of deep brown sugar malt with light fruity ester. Taste is sweeter then expected with a very solid caramel malt backbone with limited ester notes (less then I was expecting) and loads of residual brown sugar notes. Body is quite full with limited filtration  and good carbonation with no apparent alcohol. Sweeter then expected with too much residual sugar  enjoyable nonetheless but more complexity from the yeast profile would have improve this one.

750 ml bottle. Thanks Luc. An off-white sheet calmly settles over the cloudy dark orangey mahogany liquid. A very malty brew, loaded with bready, spicy pumpernickel, cakey, maple-like cereals. This makes for a round, smoothly carbonated offering that feels plain desserty. Banana puree opens up from the estery yeast while earthy, almost floral hops remain in a supporting role. While intensely malty, this is not overly sweet, thanks to a fair bit of earthy background, a well-integrated, never straightforward wheatiness as well as a certain spiciness from the yeast that balances out the roundness sugars. Timid on the phenols and never too alcoholic, thats a solid first bottling for BdT. Looking forward to more.
Pours a dark  brown with a thin beige head.  Aroma is sweet caramel, malts and banana.  Taste is medium body, sweetness of caramel up front.  Caramel malt and slight biscuity banana.  Nice beer.

750ml Bottle  (Bottled: 2/14/11.  #: 185.):  Got in trade from sammy: THANKS Sammy!  Sweet aroma of malt, wheat, spice, banana, clove, light yeast, coriander, dates, caramel, light dark ripe fruit, and hints of vanilla, nuts, and toasting.  Poured very dark orange/deep amber/brown in color with a small, creamy, desne, tan/beige head that diminished but lasted throughout as a film on top of the beer.  Cloudy.  Sparkling.  Good lacing.  Complex flavor is medium to heavily sweet and slightly bitter.  Tastes of malt, wheat, banana, caramel, toffee, light yeast, slight nuts, slight spice, light toasting, and some sugar.  Medium body.  Dry texture.  Average carbonation.  Complex finish of malt, wheat, spice, slight toasting, light banana, slight yeast, and a hint of vanilla is dry.  8%ABV is completely hidden throughout.

Bottle. Aroma is a mixture of smoke, biscuit and some esters/banany. Flavour is largely similar with more wheaty flavours coming though, definitely banana, bready, some sweetness and some roast. A really nice beer and pretty unique glad I got to try this.

UPDATED: JUL 30, 2012 Bouteille 750 ml. 8%. Couleur brune-orangée, un peu rougeâtre, brouillée. Arômes de fruits mûrs, fraises et houblon. Goût de banane, fruits et alcool. Un peu de chocolat.  Très douce en bouche, excellente.

Enjoyed on tap at the brewpub.  Without the bottle conditioning yeast.  Amber colour, lacey.  Not so drinkable.  Again a little astringent in the finish and above average carbonation, which it doesnt need.

UPDATED: SEP 3, 2013 draught at the brewery. cloudy dark copper, not quite brown, with a notable head, good retention and lacing. wheat, chocolate malts, bananas and spices, medium to full body, average carbonation. grassy-spicy finish. hint of sweetness. good brew but not awesome.

2010-10-13. Light brown body with a  modest beige head. 3+ Flavour starts out drier than I expected, malty with dry toasty accents, slight caramel hints and light warming alcohol in the finish that hints at the alcohol content. 6+ Aroma is similar, muted malt,  with accents of toasted malt and caramel. Light grainy touches like biting into dry malted barley. 6+ Average plus palate is fairly carbonated. 3+ Decent, simply, but dangerously drinkable. Estery notes finally start to show the "weizen" character as it warms up. On tap at the brewpub.

[on tap at brewpub]
Weak, slight banana aroma with some grain. Almost clear orange-brown with a white ring. Banana and nutty flavour with slight bread crust and a faint orange accent. Warming, moderate carbonation, slightly bitter finish.

Glass, 12-ouncde, draught, savoured on March 29 2010; eye: caramel with reddish hue, hazy, no effervescence, nice ring of creamy beige head; nose: malt, caramel, spices (coriander, star anise), banana; mouth: malt, caramel, coriander, star anise, banana, clove, finale in malt with presence of spices and banana, good carbonation, alcoholic texture, light acidity from the wheat; overall: quite good

FRANÇAIS

Verre, 12 onces, en fût, savourée le 29 mars 2010; il : caramel avec des reflets rougeâtres, trouble, pas deffervescence, bel anneau de mousse beige crémeuse; nez : malt, caramel, épices (coriandre, anis étoilé), banane; bouche : malt, caramel, coriandre, anis étoilé, banane, clou de girofle, finale en malt avec présence dépices et de banane, corsée, bonne carbonatation, texture alcoolique, légère acidité du blé; en résumé : bien bon

In short: A lightly spicy banana cake in a pint.  Very good.
How: Tap at brewpub
The look: Cloudy amber body topped by a very small beige head
In long: Nose of ripe bananas and toasted wheat.  Taste has toasted wheat, some caramel, ripe bananas, freshly baked banana cake, yeast, light spiciness, fruit cake.  To me this doppelbock had a strong weizen bock flavor profile.  Whatever it was I liked it.  The name DumDum is the nickname of the brewer.  Im so happy to see that after so many years his dream of being a brewer in his own brewpub came through.  This gives me hope to one day become a yodeling porcupine pathologist in a treehouse clinic.

On tap at BDT in Vieux-Hull. Beer arrived with a decent head of fine tan bubbles, that disappeared after 3-5 minutes. The beer itself is a cloudy oak brown in colour, with little effervescence. Initial aromas of bananas and toasted caramel, backed by a little yeastyness. In the mouth the flavours are dominated by a classic doppelbock banana toffee, with a rich, silky mouthfeel. Beer finishes with a sweet, yeasty bread flavour lingering.

A reddish brown doppelbock with a thin light moka head. A nice aroma of prunes, dark fruit esters, very smooth. In mouth, a classic doppelbock, with banana cake with chocolate notes, light berry notes, warming alcohol, dark fruits. Rich and smooth. On tap at brewpub, April 16 2010.

Drank on tap (12 oz) at the brewpub. April 11, 2010. Hazy caramel brown, small head. Aroma of malted wheat, caramelized spices. Taste of bananas and creamy fruits, spicy malted wheat, aftertaste of alcohol slightly imposing. Quite a fantasy Dum Dum!

On tap at the brewpub. Dark amber body with decent off-white creamy head. Nice malty/hoppy aroma with fruity and spicy hints. Very well balanced taste. It carries fruity, yeasty, and coriander notes. Ends with a good bittersweet finish. Well done.
